programme.title: Battle of the Bins: End of Weekly Collections? Tonight
programme.desc: With stretched local authorities across the country proposing restrictions on weekly bin collections, Joe Crowley investigates fears that a reduction in collections and smaller household bins has already contributed to increasing problems with littering and fly-tipping

programme.title: The Dry
programme.desc: Shiv's morning yoga routine is unexpectedly interrupted and she and her mum clash over her job prospects. Shiv's first priority is finding a recovery meeting so she can get a job after that, but her goal is complicated by meeting an old teacher and being offered some home truths

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.desc: Graham Norton hosts the revival of the game show in which office manager Shirley, financial management assistant Cameron and police investigation officer Adele compete to solve word puzzles to get the chance to spin the wheel and win big money prizes

programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features

programme.title: This Morning

programme.desc: Ella's behaviour is alarming, Pollard gets the wrong idea, and Mandy is worried

programme.title: Scotland Tonight: Trapped In A Family Trust
programme.desc: Current affairs programme delving into stories beyond the headlines. Featuring live studio debates and comprehensive analysis, it sheds light on key stories impacting the nation and its surroundings

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: Kevin and Tyrone row over their wayward offspring after Jack and Hope have a brush with the law, Mick invites Chesney for a drink, Theo and Todd get passionate, and Dee-Dee resolves to make an official complaint

programme.title: DEC Myanmar Earthquake Appeal

programme.title: Cancer Under 50: Searching For Answers - Tonight
programme.desc: When the Princess of Wales revealed her cancer diagnosis in 2024, it brought attention to a disturbing global trend - cancer is no longer just an illness of the elderly. Rebecca Barry delves into the causes behind a rise in cancer diagnoses among adults under the age of 50 in the UK, and asks what can be done to halt this worrying pattern

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son hit the road together on a series of adventures, travelling this time to Japan, where they begin in Tokyo. Together, the pair visit one of the country's biggest and most bizarre shops, get a taste for the national sport of sumo and enjoy some karaoke before resting their heads in one of the city's unique capsule hotels. Brad's fear of heights is tested by hanging on a bridge in the Arakawa Valley

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: Alison meets two of the longest staying residents at the shelter, an inseparable pair of golden labradors who are looking for a forever home, and helps a three-month old whippet with swimming lessons. She also befriends a shy maltese with trust issues

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurse Ben battles to shock a patient's heart electrically while nurse Kerryn has to manipulate a young boy's leg fracture.

programme.desc: Daily escape designed to calm the mind and encourage relaxation and reflection

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Married couple Arj and Charlotte are back to continue their game. Arj wants to open a restaurant and Charlotte wants to get a giant rabbit, but can Ant and Dec help make their dreams come true as they make their way up the money ladder? It's then the turn of best friends from Northern Ireland Phil and Arainn. They've got their eyes on half a million pounds and a trip to The Masters with their friends as they play, but can they cash out in time?

programme.title: Emmerdale

programme.title: UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: England v Belgium (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' third Group A3 match, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. England made a strong start to their campaign with a draw in Portugal and a 1-0 win against world champions Spain at Wembley. Belgium are without a point so far, but were only narrowly defeated on both occasions and will be looking to give another good account of themselves this evening. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: ITV News
programme.desc: A fresh perspective on the major stories of the day, featuring national and international news, with reports and analysis from ITV's correspondents

programme.title: The 1% Club
programme.desc: Quiz game show hosted by Lee Mack in which the questions have nothing to do with remembering facts, but are all about logic and common sense. A hundred contestants begin every show, but who will make it to the end and answer a question only one per cent of the country can get right - and win up to 100,000?

programme.title: Grantchester
programme.desc: A murder at a local old folks' home sees Will and Geordie given the run around when they try to track down two of its elderly residents. Clem Preston, a mischievous raconteur with a tall tale for every occasion, and fun-loving Ida Merryman, have gone missing and are suspected of involvement in the crime. Are they guilty or are the duo leading the police on a wild goose chase - and if so - why?

programme.title: M&S: Dress the Nation
programme.desc: AJ Odudu and Vernon Kay host the grand final as the three remaining designers create their own full clothing collections and showcase their designs in a catwalk event. Cat Deeley and Bella Freud join as guest judges and one winner is chosen for their dream job as a fashion designer at high street giant M&S

programme.title: Tipping Point: Best Ever Finals
programme.desc: Compilation of some of the most dramatic endgames from the arcade-themed quiz show hosted by Ben Shephard, in which the last contestant standing competes for a 10,000 jackpot

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Can Kelly from Bury St Edmunds, Nathan from Hull, Ged from Glasgow and Hannah originally from Huddersfield work together as a team and take down one of the country's finest quiz brains? Bradley Walsh hosts as they try to beat the Chaser for thousands of pounds

programme.title: Love Your Weekend with Alan Titchmarsh
programme.desc: Alan is joined on the farm by EastEnders icon Michelle Collins and husband-and-wife acting legends Phyllis Logan and Kevin McNally - we also say hello to a horse that is rarer than the giant panda, and rum ambassador Ian Burrell shares his top rums for mums for Mothering Sunday as well

programme.title: UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: England v Belgium (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' third Group A3 match, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. England made a strong start to their campaign with a draw in Portugal and a 1-0 win against world champions Spain at Wembley. Belgium are without a point so far, but were only narrowly defeated on both occasions and will be looking to give another good account of themselves this evening. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Coronation Street

programme.title: Cancer Under 50: Searching For Answers - Tonight
programme.desc: When the Princess of Wales revealed her cancer diagnosis in 2024, it brought attention to a disturbing global trend - cancer is no longer just an illness of the elderly. Rebecca Barry delves into the causes behind a rise in cancer diagnoses among adults under the age of 50 in the UK, and asks what can be done to halt this worrying pattern

programme.title: Bradley & Barney Walsh: Breaking Dad
programme.desc: The actor and his son hit the road together on a series of adventures, travelling this time to Japan, where they begin in Tokyo. Together, the pair visit one of the country's biggest and most bizarre shops, get a taste for the national sport of sumo and enjoy some karaoke before resting their heads in one of the city's unique capsule hotels. Brad's fear of heights is tested by hanging on a bridge in the Arakawa Valley

programme.title: For the Love of Dogs with Alison Hammond
programme.desc: Alison meets two of the longest staying residents at the shelter, an inseparable pair of golden labradors who are looking for a forever home, and helps a three-month old whippet with swimming lessons. She also befriends a shy maltese with trust issues

programme.title: Emergency Nurses: A&E Stories
programme.desc: Emergency nurse Ben battles to shock a patient's heart electrically while nurse Kerryn has to manipulate a young boy's leg fracture.

programme.title: Ant & Dec's Limitless Win
programme.desc: Married couple Arj and Charlotte are back to continue their game. Arj wants to open a restaurant and Charlotte wants to get a giant rabbit, but can Ant and Dec help make their dreams come true as they make their way up the money ladder? It's then the turn of best friends from Northern Ireland Phil and Arainn. They've got their eyes on half a million pounds and a trip to The Masters with their friends as they play, but can they cash out in time?

programme.desc: Ed Chamberlin presents coverage of day two of the event from Aintree, including the 3.30 Melling Chase and the 4.05 Topham Chase, plus races at 1.45, 2.20, 2.55 and 4.40. With analysis from AP McCoy, Ruby Walsh, Adele Mulrennan and Mick Fitzgerald, reports by Matt Chapman and Luke Harvey, betting news from Brian Gleeson, commentary by Richard Hoiles, and Social Stable updates from Oli Bell and Sam Quek

programme.title: The Chase
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as Sylvester from Surrey, Juliet from Halifax, Grace from Birmingham and Dan from High Wycombe pit their wits against one of the ruthless Chasers in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. programme.title: UEFA Women's Nations League
programme.desc: England v Belgium (Kick-off 8.00pm). Seema Jaswal presents all the action from both teams' third Group A3 match, held at Ashton Gate in Bristol. England made a strong start to their campaign with a draw in Portugal and a 1-0 win against world champions Spain at Wembley. Belgium are without a point so far, but were only narrowly defeated on both occasions and will be looking to give another good account of themselves this evening. With analysis from Ian Wright and Karen Carney, commentary by Seb Hutchinson and Lucy Ward, and reports from Katie Shanahan

programme.title: Grantchester

Clem Preston, a mischievous raconteur with a tall tale for every occasion, and fun-loving Ida Merryman, have gone missing and are suspected of involvement in the crime. Are they guilty or are the duo leading the police on a wild goose chase - and if so - why?
